Reviews.Title: “Great little B & B Hotel”
Reviews.Author: marceljt
Reviews.Content: Good location in Latin quarter as base to explore Paris. Clean and smart little City hotel with some nice features. Buffet breakfast fine but seating area limited so may have slight delay when busy. Plenty of restaurants nearby to enjoy local food (Rue Pascal). Helpful staff. Short walk to Metro - pass can also be used on buses. Would use again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly but basic”
Reviews.Author: Kim163
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very much a 3-star. Room was small and the noise of the traffic could be heard through the closed window. We did not have a bath in our room (just had a shower) and the bed was extremely hard. However, staff were very friendly and the hotel clean. In terms of location, it was further from the main tourist areas, than I would have like, with a 30 minute walk to Notre Dame. But, for strolling around Boulaneries, Pattiseries then this is a nice area.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff, Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: lola2day
Reviews.Content: Stayed last week with my dear friend. Neither of us are as nimble as we used to be and when we asked for a room that was easy to access, it was there. When we needed some ice for a knee that was out for the evening, no issues. They asked us many times if we needed assistance. Hats off to the amazing reception staff at GHG! Location is very close to Rue Monge and Rue Moufftard will make it my preferred area for the future. Four great buses (27, 47, 83, and 91) transect at the corner. # 47 is an amazing route to/from Notre Dame/San Michel. . The close location to Rue Royal RER stop and convenient bus 91 (no stairs to bring your bag up from RER station, 10 steps to bus stop!) make this an easy trek in from CDG.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!!!”
Reviews.Author: Angela S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a week and had no complaints about it. The staff was also friendly and helpful. The room we had was very big (by Paris standards) and clean. The breakfast was delightful. We found the room to be very quiet and the bed super comfortable. We were happy to find a safe we could use in our room, which was nice. It was close to the metro. Close to many great restaurants. If you like walking, you can walk to Notre Dame and other attractions in about 30-40min. We stayed at another hotel after this one (just to try another location of Paris out), but it did not even compare to how great this hotel was. We had some good times!

Reviews.Title: “Would happily stay here again”
Reviews.Author: KevinandDL
Reviews.Content: Our room was larger than expected given the reviews we had read, and despite overlooking the main road there was little noise from the road and realistically little noise from surrounding rooms. We were in Room 10, a clean, comfortable room with a spacious bathroom. This hotel was just perfect for our short trip to Paris. A short walk from the Metro, with helpful staff, we would happily stay here again. Breakfast was simple, but sufficient. The room could have done with tea & coffee facilities, but this is the only real criticism I can think of for a hotel in this price range.

Reviews.Title: “What, no tea and coffee making facilities in the room?”
Reviews.Author: ThisIsFeedback
Reviews.Content: As the title suggests, I am a bit disappointed to find there are no provisions for making a cup of tea or coffee in the room. I was offered a kettle at reception when I queried this but though it a little useless without any tea bags or instant coffee?! Still it is only a 3* hotel said the receptionist... I have stated in cheaper places that still provide the basics. Little grumble over.

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless in Paris”
Reviews.Author: YvesStGullbekk
Reviews.Content: It is actually my last night at this hotel while I am writing this review. Yes, because I find it VERY impossible to sleep due to noises EVERYWHERE! Walls are paper thin! I totally regret staying at this hotel. DO NOT be fooled by those reviews. The area is great but the hotel is NOT. In fairness to the staff, they are polite and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: Tipsforyou1
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. It was easy to find from the metro station and conveniently located near to Rue Mouffetard (a long road full of lovely restaurants). If you enjoy walking, it's easy to find your way from the hotel to the heart of Paris. The room was a much better size than we would expect in Paris and the bathroom was a great size with a separate toilet. The staff were friendly and welcoming. We would definitely stay here again. Thank you to everyone at the Grand Hotel des Gobelins.

Reviews.Title: “Fab little hotel”
Reviews.Author: jweigham
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner stayed at this hotel and we don't have a bad word to say! We luckily got a a room on the top floor facing the direction of the Eiffel Tower. Laying on the bed we actually had a clear view of the Eiffel Tower - it was just brilliant! The room was just right and had a nice bathroom. The reception staff were very helpful and pleasant. The breakfast is simple in comparison to full english etc we have in England, but that is just the Parisian way, we had some lovely croissaints with differents jams/spread, cereals and lovely bread with cheese and ham. The hotel is a very short walk to to Gobelins metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: lpansieri
Reviews.Content: After a long flight, I was relieved to have access to my room at 10:30 AM. Our small crowded room (superior) was clean, but not immaculate. The bedspread and blanket could use a good cleaning.It is true that we do hear noise, either from the street or from other rooms. So, if you are a light sleeper, it is something to consider when choosing this hotel.We found the staff here very courteous and the man who serves breakfast is extremely pleasant. The continental breakfast is quite acceptable, however, the coffee isn't very good.On the other hand, other beverages are available. This reasonably priced hotel is located at the limit of the Latin Quarter of Paris with easy metro and bus access to the central tourist attractions....a supermarket, bakery and restaurants just steps away.

Reviews.Title: “Gremlins in Gobelins...”
Reviews.Author: Nostromo
Reviews.Content: The Grand Hotel des Gobelins sits in the Boulevard San Marcel, between two metro stations: San Marcel - about 5 minutes walk with a direct line (5) to Gare de Nord (which takes about 20 minutes, and perfect for connecting to Eurostar) and the Metro Gobelins (line 7) - which is nearer but will involve more complicated interchanges. It's ideally situated for transport, and just a short walk from the Latin Quarter. Indeed, it's only a 30 minute walk to Notre Dame Cathedral. Although it will take longer if you stroll through the Rue de Mouffetard and it's myriad of cobbled streets and eccentric bars and shops - which is a fundamental reason for being there in the first place. So what's the problem? Why have I given a poor rating? That's because I am rating the Hotel, not the area (which is charming) and the hotel is a smoke and mirrors affair. The staff are surly and distant.There is no "warmth" in this establishment. The rooms which are lauded as "standard" are basic, and very small. Visitors to mainland Europe can expect small rooms, but this hotel exploits the premise. I booked a double room only to discover that I had two single beds shoved together, and there was barely enough space to accommodate two hand carries. My wife and I travelled light on a short break and we had no large suitcases. So consider this if you have them. There is an elevator, which excuses the employees from assisting you with your luggage, but that is a minor point. There is no shower curtain in the bathroom, as stated by some previous reviewers, but I really didn't know how important this was. The force of the shower is significant, and no matter how you position it whilst standing in the bath, the water goes everywhere. This creates a very wet floor, and to compensate it is necessary to place towels to absorb it, otherwise you will literally be splashing around just to brush your teeth and use the toilet. They have a sign on the bathroom wall which says (roughly translated) that in the interest of the environment, please be sparing with water, conserve your towels, and if you want to change them, leave them in the bath! So why don't they have shower curtains or screens? They must go through a lot of towels. In two days we went through eight, but only because we had to use them to walk on! The rooms have the old large radiators which cannot be individually controlled so the room gets very hot, but fortunately the windows open to alleviate it. I tried fiddling with the thermostat but it was a lost cause. There is only one power point in the room, so bring an extension cable if you have devices that need charging - for example, batteries, phones, laptops. The hotel gives free internet access, but they will take a copy of your passport before giving access codes and passwords. Don't ask me why - by this time I was past caring! There's a tiny flat screen tv situated just under the ceiling at an awkward angle, and has a volume limit barely audible - but that's presumably to ensure that the neighbours don't hear each other - by the way, I forgot to mention the walls are paper thin! The tv remote had not been cleaned, and it wasn't something you would want to handle for very long. The ceiling was cracked, there were unusual bubble formations on it, and all told it was the pits. There was a table but the chair could not extend from it because there was no room - well that's because they tried to make a double room out of a single! So I went to reception and complained and was told I should speak to the manager. The manager wasn't there - and I wasn't surprised. So don't be fooled by the pictures, this is a shocking and poor hotel and there must be far better ones to spend your money with. They do a decent continental breakfast, but you wouldn't expect anything less in Paris. Croissants, yogurt, cereal, ham, etc - but you can get all that and more around any street corner. I regret making this negative review - but frankly the Grand des Gobelins deserves every single word of it.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: mimi210473
Reviews.Content: Pleasant hotel,a little further from the centre of Paris than I would usually stay.On arrival the reception staff were polite but not at all friendly.We were allowed to check in 1 hour earlier than the standard check in time of 2pm.The room was fine,clean,modern and spacious enough for 2 people to stay for a couple of days.The bathroom was very nice,and although the shower was fantastically powerful,there was no shower curtain over the bath.The only real disappointment for me was the attrocious breakfast.It's hard to understand how a basic continental breakfast can go so wrong.The coffee was undrinkable,the meagre selection of ham and cheese was curling at the ends,the orange juice was warmer than room temperature,so we had to seek breakfast elsewhere.The Canon des Gobelins on the corner serve a lovely continental breakfast for 8.50 euro's. I won't be staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TitaMerello
Reviews.Content: Pros: Nice, small, clean hotel in excellent location full of restaurants, 10 minutes from Rue Mouffetard, and 2 minutes from subway station. You can walk to many attractions. Breakfast is fine and is included. Cons: noisy room--the hotel faces a boulevard-- and the room needed some maintenance: no shower curtain so the bath was a mess, a bath light did not work, and due to a missing part we could not control the heating system so it was extremely hot.The cleaning lady NEVER replaced the soap after the first day and we stayed for a week. One morning, she disregarded the 'do not disturb' sign three times and tried to enter the room and even called when we were sleeping. With the exception of the gentleman who was at the front desk in the morning, the staff was pretty bad, specially the lady working some afternoons. She was extremely rude when we asked for soap once--which she did not provide by the way. All in all, too many options out there--even in the same location--to come back here and I would not recommend it either.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: lreidgreen
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice. The room was reasonably sized by European standards and the bathroom was huge and nicely appointed. I appreciated that the toilet was in a separate room from the bath. The room was very clean but it faced the street and it was a bit loud. We had to turn the heat off because the room was getting too hot. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful in directing us to the station for our trip to Versailles. They were less than helpful in directing us to the nearby Gobelins tapestry works. They had never heard of it! Since this was our fourth visit to Paris we wanted to see something a little bit different. Tip: unless you understand French miss the tapstry works because the tour was completely in French. The breakfast here was OK but nothing special. I know not to expect eggs for breakfast in Paris but it would have been nice to have some fresh fruit instead of the canned stuff they served. The nearby Italian restaurant was great but I was not impressed with the restaurants on rue Mouffetard that were mentioned by other reviewers.Very touristy and mediocre. Except for our first night we went elsewhere for dinner. This hotel was near two Metro stops and was conveniently located to the RER station at Gare Austerlitz for the trip to Versailles. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, hospitable and dependable, and a good location too”
Reviews.Author: U A
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel twice in the last few months - once alone, once with my wife. In both cases the room was very clean, in sharp condition, and comfortable. The service at the desk was always friendly, and the overall ambiance was very hospitable. There are several different room styles, some more to my taste than others. In all the rooms I saw (4) the bath and shower were new and in very good condition. Breakfast is a bit basic, including fresh bread and croissant, spreads, salami, ham, cheese, cornflakes, granola and some fruit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: hop2it_11
Reviews.Content: Ive booked again for July 2012 (before and after our holiday to Antibes) and am really looking forward to staying in this small but comfortable hotel. We had a family room which was a good size with a separate toilet and a large ensuite bathroom. Although our room was situated around a court yard the room was quiet and we had not problems in getting to sleep. Did not need air con and had the window open which was directly on to the main road - no problems. Very comfortable bed. Breakfast was very good and the staff were friendly and extremely helpful. We went to the nearby Market on Rue Moufettard which had some great shops and restaurants. We also visited the nearby Botanical gardens. The hotel is small and the photos are quite deceptive the breakfast room is very small and the mirrored wall makes it look sizeable which it isnt. We had to wait to be seated. There are some very interesting photographs taken around the time of the second world war on the landings which are worth a look at. Visit the Sunday market at Bastille 9it is amazing for food and other goods. The only negative I have is in trying to get the hotel to acknowledge our booking - but they do speak very good english if you need to speak to the reception staff in person.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable in a good location”
Reviews.Author: TelfordMel
Reviews.Content: We had a very comfortable 4 nights here in September. The staff were very friendly and the room was clean and big enough as we were out all day. The only downside was that there was no air conditioning so we had to keep the window open which let in noise from the street but after a couple of nights we had got used to it. The hotel is situated in a nice area within walking distance of many restaurants in one direction and the Seine in the other. I would return to this hotel if I ever went to Paris again and can recommend it to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good size room”
Reviews.Author: MnJAus
Reviews.Content: Hotel was easy to get to from train station with stations close by to hotel. There was not much happening on the street except for the nice pattiseerie directly opposite hotel. We did a few nice walks to the siene river to see the notre dame which is a good 40mins walk but enjoyed it as we passed some great shops and experienced the Parisian lifestyle. There is a great restaurant strip close by, around 15mins walk, called Rue Muttafad (not sure about spelling) which we went to almost every night during our 5 night stay. Bike hire is close by and is a fun way to get around the city. We were impressed with the decent size of the room. Nice bathroom with good size bath. The only issue which people have commented before is there is no shower curtain and water goes everywhere on the floor but it didn't bother us too much as they replaced towels everyday. Brekky at hotel was simple but nice. We lived the croissants with nutella. They were always fresh. Would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, good location and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Janet492
Reviews.Content: Just spent 7 nights in Paris and enjoyed it immensely. Our hotel room (superior double, 2 twin beds) was comfortable, clean and plenty of room. European hotel rooms are very small compared with North American hotel rooms so we were happy to see that our room was large enough for the two of us and our 2 suitcases. The bathroom was large for a european 3 star hotel with a separate toilet. I thought the mattress was comfortable (my sister said it was too hard). The regular double rooms will be smaller therefore I didn't mind spending a little more to get a bigger room.The staff were friendly and helpful as well. Plenty of cafe's and bakeries in the area too. Easy access by metro, trains and city buses. I recommend this hotel and would definitely go back. Merci.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gcs172
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 6 nights in September. We had queen bed. The room was big enough to be comfortable in. The bed was nice, the room was clean, charming and the bathroom had just recently been redone with a nice bath/ shower. The location is near the Jardin des Plantes and a short walk to Gare d'Austerlitz or Place d'Italie. The staff is very friendly and helpful and speak English. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: chris21Illinois
Reviews.Content: This place is great for anyone! I stayed in this hotel with my husband and son (8 yrs.) for 10 days. I had already made a reservation before we left, and I'm so glad that we decided to stay here for all ten days. Grand Hotel des Gobelins is small, but definitely has class. Our room was a good size with two queen beds. The bathroom with the shower and tub are in a separate room from the toilet. The room with the toilet was small, but you're only using it for one reason, so why does it have to be big? The "shower/tub/sink room is very large. All of the rooms were always clean, and the people were always very friendly. They were even helpful in telling us how to get to different sights and cities. In my opinion, this hotel is located right in the center of Paris. We were actually able to cover all of the things that we wanted to see. You can take the bus, train or walk. We were also able to take public transportation to Lille and Versailles. Lille was actually recommended to us by a couple of the desk workers. The supermarkets were literally a block away, as well as boulangeries. Anytime you get hungry, you can go and grab a sandwich. They are delicious and the people that work there are extremely friendly. Make sure to be polite and say merci : ) This hotel had a typical European breakfast which I thought was awesome. You had your meats (ham, salame), cheeses, yogurt, croissants and chocolate. There was also cereal and containers of peaches, which would be like our canned fruit here. I mixed it with yogurt and it was delicious. There was coffee, milk and juice. I booked our whole vacation thru expedia and boy was it a good deal. The breakfast was included everyday. Look into this option. To sum it up, we were very pleased with this hotel and would stay here again in a heartbeat. There is a school right in front of the hotel and it is located in a fun, friendly and convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great location!”
Reviews.Author: SEK022
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights and enjoyed this hotel. The room itself was small, but clean and comfortable. The breakfast, included in the price, was very tasty and plentiful - a great way to start each day. We also found the location to be very good - close to a metro stop and a nice sense of 'neighbourhood' including the very tasty goods and friendly staff at the local patisserie, La Chocolatine! Our only complaint was the shower - no shower curtain which made for a small flood each morning on the floor that we had to clean up. We would certainly stay at this hotel again, we enjoyed it very much!

Reviews.Title: “Happy with our choice”
Reviews.Author: Tourizt
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took a 2 night stopover in Paris on a longer flight. Made the reservation based on attractive pricing from Hotels.com and Reviews from Trip Advisor. Pleased to report we could not have made a better choice. Great location, minutes away from public transit including Metro, right next to a Carrefour, very helpful staff and very room bathroom....everything was perfect. Have no hesitation in recommending, will sure stay again.....

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: lmouttet
Reviews.Content: Rooms are compact but extremely clean, well appointed, have a good vibe and fresh. Breakfast was good also. Very central to 3 metro stops, lots of restaurants, supermarkets and bakeries closeby. Front desk staff very helpful....extremely good value for money. Would definitely stay here again !!!

Reviews.Title: “I would look elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: JadeTzi
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure what the other rooms are like although most positions seem similar so I would assume lay out Is the same - room is the smallest I have ever stayed in. Barely enough room for the double bed and then no where to put ur bags. I'm alone so can get by by If there is two of you don't bother - pay the extra and stay somewhere you can move in. Hotel also Does NOT have Air Con as it states on it's website only tiny little table fan which doesnt help on muggy days. Also no minibar fridge.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, excellent breakfast, excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: HelenM089
Reviews.Content: The hotel exceeded my expectations. It was lovely and the staff were all without exception friendly, polite and extremely helpful. The room was great and the breakfast was really good (great coffee and croissants). The location is excellent - near to the metro, bus and plently of restaurants, cafes etc nearby. I was sad to leave and will certainly be going back :) My only complaint was the bed was too comfortable so I didn't want to get up!

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel, in great non-touristy area”
Reviews.Author: jeremicium
Reviews.Content: I brought my wife and mother to Paris for my moms 60th birthday. We stayed six nights at the Hotel Des Gobelins. Our triple room was small but clean and functional. There was a seperate toilet/bathroom area which was convenient. All of the hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. The complimentary breakfast was perfect. Good coffee, very good croissants, meats, cheese, cold cereal, and a few other things. There is a grocery store open from 9a.m. until 10p.m. a few doors down, and the Gobelins metro is a few short blocks away (5 minute walk max). Also, the line to Versaille is just a 10-15 minute walk. Several cafe's, restaurant's and Bakeries all within a few minute walk. Overall I would certainly recommend this hotel. It's not in the heart of the city, but it is in a great, clean, working class neighboorhood.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet escape in a real part of Paris”
Reviews.Author: ruvb
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Paris, and we were a bit apprehensive about staying in such a residential area (just because we weren't 100% sure on how it would be getting around and such). However, we were pleasantly surprised at how much we enjoyed coming back to the Logis Grand Hotel des Gobelins every evening. The metro stop was fairly close, and there are countless great restaurants and bakeries along Saint Marcel and Rue Gobelins. We loved the view of adorable Parisian apartment buildings through our window - we were on the top floor of the hotel so it was definitely the best. The area is busy around the restaurants, but quiet and very conducive to a good sleep. Breakfast was more than the standard Parisian breakfast (based on what friends had told us it generally is) - the croissants and mini-baguettes were delicious, and the yoghurt, fruits, and jams were nice, too. Staff were all helpful, from the front desk down to the cleaning. Our room was clean, bright, comfortable, and a good size for the two of us. The only issues we had were, like with most other reviewers, with the lack of shower coverage (so it was a little inconvenient to wipe down the floor after every shower) and with having to leave the keys at the front desk before leaving the hotel. They never asked us for ID when we came to pick up our key upon our return, so as North Americans used to more security measures it was a bit worrisome (but I guess in the 13ieme they don't have these kinds of problems?). Another comment about the area is that there is nowhere to exchange money around there, so ensure you do it before arrival or look out for an exchange bureau in the touristy areas (i.e. Rue du Rivoli). Finally, we really appreciated the nicer smells of the area as compared to much of tourist Paris. I will take bakeries and restaurant food wafting around over goodness knows what that we smelled in the parks and subways any day!

Reviews.Title: “such a great place to stay, you know your in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: kel_and_one
Reviews.Content: Fantastic stay, with my mum celebrating mothers day and my birthday. The hotel is just perfect for anyone who wants to stay in a real parisean hotel. Close to the Metro, so getting about is easy. Special thank you to the lady who looks after everyone at breakfast, as she works so hard. All the staff are extremely friendly and helpful and if like me your french is severly lacking, your not made to feel stupid. Well done to all, you run a great hotel and I promise to visit again, but hopefully next time with a better grasp of the language.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: farawayhats52
Reviews.Content: Very near to 2 metro stations and lots of good restaurants. The main road was fairly busy, so to have a window open at night made sleeping difficult. The bed was large but was made up from 2 singles, not so good, although it was comfortable. The room was not large, but hey, we only slept there. The bathroom was clean and well maintained, BUT why there was no shower curtain, I have no idea. We regularly flooded the floor. Breakfast were fine, with the usual bread, cheese, ham etc. But the dining room was a bit small and cramped when full. Although the service at breakfast was very good. The staff we dealt with were helpful and friendly. There is a lift so staying on the 5 floor as we were was no problem. One thing I did notice, was we could hear another rooms bathroom, when in use, so I guess the sound-proofing is not so good.

Reviews.Title: “Cute and convenient”
Reviews.Author: vengajen
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my best friend Hilary this past September to Paris, and we chose this hotel based on TripAdvisor reviews. I'm really glad we did! The hotel was in a nice location, close to a Metro stop, and was also within walking distance of many things to do. When we first checked in, our room was a tad small for the two of us - so we requested a larger room. This was our introduction to the dynamic and animated front desk clerk, who made us laugh the rest of the trip with his hilarious (sassy French humor) statements. He arranged for us to move to a larger room, which was much nicer! The bathroom was very very nice. The hotel offers a complimentary breakfast, which was OK - I remember eating a lot of croissants, applesauce, and sliced ham. I think the only drawback is that this hotel is not air conditioned, and our room faced a busy street. So, it was a bit noisy while trying to sleep at night if we wanted to stay cool....but next time I'd just bring earplugs. The pros definitely outweigh the cons :). C'est la vie!

Reviews.Title: “Clean room, great water pressure, quaint hotel close to subway.”
Reviews.Author: EmmaT_O28
Reviews.Content: Lovely, small hotel in a decent part of town. Walk to several grocery stores in minutes, boulangerie across the street, walk to metro in 5 minutes. Good breakfast available, pleasant staff, windows that open - great water pressure in shower. Safe and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Gifts I bought for friends were missing in my small room”
Reviews.Author: PengiunCN
Reviews.Content: Location is good, room is very small and noisy during the night. I stayed 6 nights in this hotel and found gifts I bought for friends are missing in my room. It's in the baggage neither. Called reception for help, was asked to call police, but I'm rushing to the airport in one hour. Will not come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Paris at its best”
Reviews.Author: 13thEarl
Reviews.Content: Location - brilliant. Away from the spivs and pickpockets and in an area actually inhabited by the French - most of the shops have blocks of flats above them. There are lots of local shops and the Moufetard area to shop in - if I lived here I would be the size of a house the snacks are so good! The hotel is about 300metres from the metro which will take you straight to the Louvre if that's your thing - otherwise change at Chatelet for anywhere else. My wife insists that I mention the magical atmosphere of the Rue Moufetard in the evenings. Service - charmingly French and helpful. Room service will not touch your room unless you put a card on the door which is fine by me! Rooms - I have stayed in plenty of hotels across Europe and for a city centre these are good. Small by American standards but quite usable. Ours had a bath / shower combo which was great and there was a room safe for valuables. The door key deadlocks the room so you turn it twice clockwise - seems some of our Colonial cousins have a problem with this! Leaving the key at reception means you don't lose it so, hey, that's a good thing. There is only air con on the top floor so this is a place best visited in autumn through to spring - the rooms are triple glazed and so quiet and warm in winter. Breakfast - A good French breakfast! For a start you get croissants and believe me not a lot of French hotels provide those. The bread is fresh, there are meats, cheeses, yoghurts, fruit, juices and cereals - you can really fill up for a good start to the day - and of course the coffee has the kick of a mule, unlike the dishwater served in some American hotels. definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a short (romantic) break.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic typically french hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cher2011
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend took me to Paris for my 20th birthday was a lovely surprise, hotel was very quaint and so very French, room although quite small looked like a scene from an old french film with lovely windows opening out onto the quiet street and a brilliant view of Paris (even the eiffel tower can be seen). Small, clean bathroom, with a hairdryer, which was handy as i had forgotten my travel plugs! Staff were friendly and helped us find our way around and let you keep you luggage there once you'd checked out. When is Paris definately stay at the Eiffel Tower after dark, sit on the grass, people come round selling wine, berr, champagne but take your own! often people singing or playing music, really lovely atomsphere especially when the tower is all lit up. Beautiful trip - managed to get alot of sightseeing in in 3 days, i would say get a map and walk and take the boat from the eiffel tower rather than the siteseeing buses.

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel...very friendly helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: becks0130
Reviews.Content: This was one of the smallest hotels I have ever stayed in! Pros... Near to Metro. (Gobelins) Very clean Lovely bathroom Excellent housekeeping Comfortable bed LIFT to all floors (all four of them, I think! Very good Reception staff, helpful and friendly! Small feel to hotel!!! A Carrefour supermarket just a stones throw up Boulevard St Marcel.(if you want some supplies for your room! Cons This hotel gives a good 'base' to sleep in! THIS IS NOT A LUXURY HOTEL! The hotel has no bar! No minibar (small selection of refreshments available at Recption!) No tea/coffee making facility in room VERY SMALL breakfast room. No dinner/lunch service. The hotel has a 'small' feel, only 9 rooms on each floor! WE FELT PHOTOS MADE ROOMS APPEAR LARGER! (so often happens!) Continental breakfast, over three days there was NO variation in anything! (but was adequate) featuring croissant, breakfast roll, conserve, butter, ham, cheese. Cereal and juice and coffee. Self service, but the bread is brought to table!

Reviews.Title: “Rude Service”
Reviews.Author: emptyvoices
Reviews.Content: If you like being mistreated and made to feel stupid, this is the hotel for you. Okay, first off, we arrived at this hotel pretty tired. The rooms still require an actual old fashioned key to unlock the door and the struggle to unlock the door was aggravated my wrist twisting it this way and that. When we came down we were rudely informed that the key stays there and that is always the way it's done in France. Basically the guy said, "This is France". I felt unsophisticated and stupid by this remark. I almost wanted to retort, Gee really? I thought we were in Germany. Anyway, the first day when housekeeping cleaned our room, she took the fan (there is no air conditioning) and all our towels. The receptionist at night seemed indifferent and acted as if we were being pests. But it was unusually warm in Paris and the rooms were stuffy and unventilated. It was a horrid mess. So, now we couldn't shower and couldn't cool down. Also, I was trying to get a bottle of water for my friend whom was sick and queasy from the trip in the overly warm room...of course paying for the extra bottle and I had to wait while the guy chatted away at the Front desk on a personal call. I took some French so I understood some of his conversation. I hated my stay there. My best day and I was giddy at it, was when we took the train back to London. I don't care about the small rooms but the rudeness of the staff gave me a bad feeling and now I have to think twice of whether I will ever go back to Paris again. It's a shame because I dreamed for years of going there. Do yourselves a favor and look elsewhere. We actually had to hide our things so more items didn't go missing somehow during housekeeping.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate for a short stay but problematic for anything longer”
Reviews.Author: utex1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a week on a September vacation trip to Paris. The location was good, a couple of blocks from a metro station. The room itself and the amenities were adequate. The continential breakfast was fairly standard, certainly nothing out of the ordinary. Our major problem was that we couldn't use our universal adapter without setting off the breaker for the room. As a result, nothing that we needed to recharge could be recharged. For a couple of days stay that would have been fine but for a week it created difficulties we could have done without.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel with awful service!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mrsmcbride725
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself wasn't bad, just average. The rooms were small, the doors still had key lock, which hardly worked. We had to struggle with the lock every time. My main complaint was the fact that when we went out for the day, we put the "do not disturb" sign on the door. When we returned at the end of the day, the room was made up, which would have been fine if my night gown was still in the room. Yes, my nightgown was taken, whether on purpose or accident, it was gone! When I asked the concierge, he made me feel stupid, as if I misplaced it. He said no one had it, but to leave my info in case it was found. He was very rude! I'd never recommend this hotel, for the mere fact of my missing nighty! So strange!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean room, bathroom is tiny”
Reviews.Author: raoliver
Reviews.Content: This was a good value close to the metro and not very many stops from everything you want to see in Paris. The staff was exceedingly helpful. The breakfast was okay. There are restaurants along the same blvd as the hotel and a nice littel pattiserie across the street. I would definitely stay again. The room was rather small and the shower was tiny, but from what I understand, that's to be expected - particularly when you are traveling on a budget. This is a great lower-cost option for a visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel would definately stay again, loved Paris”
Reviews.Author: cazet
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in Paris and I absolutely loved it. The hotel was excellent value for money the staff were kind and helpful at all times. Breakfast was good and plentyful. Close to Metro and Batobus river suttle bus( Jardine des Plantes) thus easy to get to all attactions. Plenty of restaurants around to choose from. You must go to Rue Mouffetard and have the icecream of your life!!! Can't remember the name of the shop but its on the left just before you reach the square Place de le Contrescarpe. Do be aware there are some scammers around. At the Arc de Triomphe we where approached twice. First was a women claiming to be a Bosnian refugee asking if we spoke English with a card to read, saying her family where starving and she needed money. The second was a women claiming to have found a gold ring close to me and asking me if it was mine. I said no it wasn't but then she tried to give it to me saying it was gold and I should take it, I refused. When we got back to the hotel we looked on the internet and there where several storys about the Bosnian refugees and the gold ring scam. These women are not refugees they are Romainian or Gypsies and do this for a living. If you accept the ring they then try to get money out of you for giving it to you. Needless to say the rings are not gold. Basically don't be drawn in by pushy people trying to give or sell or beg from you. Hope this was helpful and you have a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely French hotel, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Natashasimpson
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights at the end of June. Although the hotel was undergoing some renovation work at the time, meaning that most of the lounge area was inaccessible, by large we were very pleased with out stay. The rooms and dining room were impeccably clean. The bedroom was very comfortable with television and air conditioning - bliss! Very peaceful at night. Shower was great. Breakfast was lovely, good choices and all tasty. We would definitely recommend this hotel and hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel in a nice location in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Gator32
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my wife and 3 children in early July. The hotel is clean and in a good location, convenient to the Metro and a short Metro ride to most of the well know sites throughout London. The front desk and breakfast room staff are extremely courteous and helpful and all spoke English. Free wireless internet service was also a big plus. There are a number of restaruants, cafes, grocery stores and shops on the same block and within a few minutes walk from the hotel. Pizza Cesar had very good Italian food (not just some pizza shop as the name might imply), and is a block away from the hotel. Negatives: It was brutally hot in Paris (high of 92 F, 33 C) and the hotel has no air conditioning. An oscillating fan was provided in the room which basically just circulates the hot air. We kept the windows open whihc provided a slight breeze, but left us exposed to all the noise on the street below. Also, there are no shower curtains or shower enclosures, which is odd. Basically, if you turn the water pressure on full blast, you will flood the bathroom floor. We learned wuickly that if you only use about half power on the shower, you can keep the water from covering the floor if you are careful. Not sure the logic in the lack of a curtain since it would seem easy and pretty inexpensive to install. Overall, we enjoyed our stay at the hotel and would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: esgai
Reviews.Content: This hotel was undergoing some work during our stay but that did not take away from the fact that it is a clean hotel in a good location. The rooms were small but when you don't spend much time there that is all you need. Staff were very friendly. Breakfast was great and kept us going into the afternoon which was great. Loads of restaurants and cafes nearby. Also a supermarket on the doorstep. Metro station was really closer which was much appreciated after a long day out!! A little bit shabby in places but what city hotel isn't like that. Good hotel, would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great little gem ... close to all.”
Reviews.Author: kathybeee
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay at Gobelins ... arrived to fantastic desk staff, always eager to help me with any enquiry i had. Breakfast great, room was clean & windows opened for fresh air. Located close to Metro & RER, a must in Paris. Would stay again ... How i love Paris !!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sloan74
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last weekend for a 2 night break with my mum for her birthday. I can not fault this hotel. The hotel is situated in the Latin quarter which is central for everything you need. The staff are really attentive and always on hand to give advice or make a restaurant reservation. The rooms are small but decorated nicely and had air conditioning. I was in room 66 which had a lovely ample sized bathroom with bath and shower. Although the hotel is on a busy road when you close the windows you can not hear any street noise. Yes the breakfast room is tiny but the lady who seats everyone makes sure that there is tables for everyone. The red open bus tour is a must and leaves from outside Notre dame which is abut a 25 minute walk from the hotel. I can not recommend this hotel enough.

Reviews.Title: “might be nice- we will never know!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Moso06
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for 2 nights in May. Arrived in the evening to be told that our room was flooed an we would be moved to a sister hotel in Bercy. The other hotel is not in as central a location nor is it as nice. They offered no compensation just a smiley apology. We felf this was a scam on their behalf. We could be wrong but I am just warning others.

Reviews.Title: “Great little base for Paris visit”
Reviews.Author: peanut3289
Reviews.Content: We came to Paris with the intention of seeing as much as possible in a long weekend - needing somewhere to sleep, have breakfast and head out for the day. This hotel is lovely, needs a little tlc round the edges, but this doesn't detract from a very sweet and cosy little hotel. Staff were very helpful, booking things for us by phone if we asked and recommending places to eat etc. Breakfast is nice - don't expect a fry up (not my thing anyway), but cereals, yoghurt, ham and cheese as well as gorgeous croissants. We had a double (two twins pushed together, which is normal for France), with a large double window/balcony onto the street. This provided good soundproofing when shut, and some air and hustle and bustle when open - perfect. The room and bathroom were very clean and well serviced/made up during the day. The only criticism I had was the smallness of the shower cubicle.....I'm an average sized person but found it a tight squeeze - just don't drop the soap as it's difficult to bend down and pick it up!! (Apart from that the shower was powerful and hot). This was not enough to put me off staying here again though.....a sweet Paris hotel for a sensible cost. The nearst Metro (Les Gobelins) was a five minute walk if you turn left out of the Hotel......ridiculously easy to get everywhere, day and night. The Rue De Mouffetard market is not much further along than the Metro station - it's charming and a feast for the senses - if you carry on through there you reach the Pantheon and a lovely walk through St Germain Du Pres....andon to the Centre of Paris....what more could you want. As for nearby restaurants.......go to Marty's, just near Les Gobelins Metro station, the best food I think I have ever tasted - and in a beautiful Art Deco setting.......the wine is to die for (Macon Village). Would recommend Le Lido for great cabaret. All in all a great weekend and a lovely hotel - 5 * in my book.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Place!”
Reviews.Author: imagana
Reviews.Content: I traveled alone through Paris and I found this hotel to be perfect. Great location. Great service. I am definitely coming back to stay here again. Everything is clean. Metro near by. I only spoke English and the staff were great service. I definitely would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling through Paris. There are nearby shops and restaurants. Post office is around the corner too for mailing postcards! :) Great area.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: SusanRobitaille
Reviews.Content: The staff was so nice, they really helped make me feel welcome here. I enjoyed chatting with Jean-Marc, the front desk clerk... he was always so pleasant! They were also gracious to help me with my French, but spoke beautiful English when I found myself stuck. :) This is a charming and typical Parisian hotel... a little old and quaint. I am very fond of the location, as I like this part of Paris. There is a metro station a stone's throw away, and a full grocery store two buildings over if you find you need anything. The famous Rue Mouffetard is just around the corner (about a 5 minute walk). The only drawback is the super tiny shower... I am a small woman (5'3) and found myself seriouly cramped. That, and the water leaks out the door if the water hits it at all. Just be aware of where the water is hitting and have a towel on the floor outside of the shower and you'll be fine. This is not a reason to not stay here... just a head's up. :) The floors are a bit squeaky, from age of the building, so hopefully you are a sound sleeper, otherwise the morning activities could wake you up. (Which is okay, best to get up and get going.) :) Over all, for the price and star-rating, I think it is a true gem!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Easy to get around Paris from here”
Reviews.Author: madchickenlittle
Reviews.Content: This hotel is lovely. The breakfast room is quite small, and breakfast is tasty but limited in selection. The hotel is convenient to the Metro, and a convenient Metro stop at that. Just down the street is a lovely Italian restaurant, and a grocery store. We shopped and ate in the room occasionally - Paris restaurants are quite expensive and we were there over Bastille holiday, so it was quite crowded with waits for tables. Good service, friendly staff, and nice, clean rooms. We overlooked the street and it wasn't too noisy to sleep, so it worked well for us.

Reviews.Title: “Girls getaway”
Reviews.Author: marc301
Reviews.Content: Six girlfriends and I went to Paris and stayed in this hotel for five nights. We were very worried about the hotel because it was quite inexpensive, to our suprise it was great. The staff was lovely and the hotel was very clean. I would definitely recommend this hotel. If I have the priveledge to return to Paris I would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, would recommend”
Reviews.Author: ACESHIGHLeeds
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights at this hotel, stayed on the top floor (6th) and had a nice view. The place was very quiet (did have a couple of chavs next door to us one night screaming and shouting, v drunk and obnoxious but evening porter did knock on their door to tell them to keep it down). Room very clean, nice decor and lovely big bathroom (shower over bath could have done with shower curtain but it did seem to be a wet room type floor so no biggie). Breakfast room is small though (served 7 to 10am which is good for a lie in!) but brekkie is v basic but nice enough - if you can choose to just book a room when you plan your holiday then you will save money and have better brekkie elsewhere. Hotel about 3 mins walk from number 7 metro line that is also on Lourve route - its one change of line from the RER B train you get from CDG airport so very easy to get to/from. Its about 30 mins walk from main night life area of latin quarter. Room came with a safe and there is a luggage hold is your flight is later then check out. Overall we liked this hotel and recommend it to anyone, we would stay again when we next visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Room_101_London
Reviews.Content: If Grand Hotel means to you liveried doormen, chocolates on the pillows and a cavernous lobby then the Grand Hotel des Gobelins does not really fit the bill but if you mean Grand in the Yorkshire sense then this hotel is truly grand! The staff are unfailingly courteous and helpful from the reception staff to the hard working breakfast waitress to the smiling chambermaid. The rooms are small but have pretty much everything you need. There is a spotless bathroom, a comortable bed, opening windows and air conditioner and free in-room wireless internet connection at the full 54mbps. The breakfast which was included is excellent and filling with the smell of fresh coffe and croissants wafting through the hotel in the morning. It is near to Les Gobelins and St Marcel metro stations which can connect you to everywhere and a good supermarket just a few doors away on a safe feeling street. I stayed for three days and it was perfect to come back to for peace and quiet and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, comfortable, friendly and clean. Would be happy to return.”
Reviews.Author: dominorat
Reviews.Content: Stayed as a valentines break. Small room, (although classed as superior) but very comfortable and very clean. Stayed in 69 which was on the top floor; and had an overbath shower, which was very welcome. (Stayed during an extremely cold/freezing spell; and although the room was very warm it was also great to have a hot bath to rejuvenate in). Thanks for the warning about no kettle: it was worth taking our own (and the outdoor window ledge was an ample fridge). Supermarket is almost immediately next door and very large. We also loved the THAI AT HOME take away/restaurant, about 5 minutes walk away.: (Turn Right out of hotel, up approx second street on right) thanks to previous reviewer for the tip. Really friendly and lovely food. Not a restaurant as such; more of a tarted up cafe atsmosphere. Back to Hotel: good breakfast (continental). It was also very useful that the hotel staff were happy for us to leave our bags with them after check out, until the evening. Staff were all very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “My third vist to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: rubylondon_England
Reviews.Content: We orginally booked a weekend break through Eurostar to stay at this hotel and we have never looked back. This was our third vist to the hotel. The rooms are very comfortable with newly decorated bathrooms. The rate usually includes a buffet breakfast which is really filling. About a two minute walk from the hotel turning left outside is a large supermarket which you can get drinks and snacks whilst out sightseeing. About 5-10minutes walk from the hotel is the superb rue Mouffetard full of resturants. You can get set lunch/dinner for really reasonable prices (15-20euro per person). Be careful at the top of the hill in a sqaure is a resturant with seats outside which is super expensive, otherwise you can eat and drink in a different place each evening, i would highly recommed 'Le pot de terre' 22, rue du pot du fer i have never had a bad meal here, always fantastic even though the staff seem constantly annoyed.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic base for Paris trip”
Reviews.Author: Davy-p999
Reviews.Content: Weeks holiday to Paris, with my wife and 17 year old son, greeted on arrival by friendly receptionist who showed us to our room and explained everything about hotel, room was to the front with a double bed and single and plenty of cupboard space, particulary liked the toilet being seperate from shower and wash hand basin area. Continental breakfast included in price which gave us a good start for our busy days sightseeing. Staff were superb booking our Moulin Rouge night and giving advice about Paris trips.I could not praise this hotel enough close to two Metro lines and fantastic restaurant, coffee shop and supermarket within 3 minutes walk. The only fault that someone may pick up on is traffic during night, due to the heat we kept our windows open all night, the noise of traffic actually had no effect on us as our back rooms at home are on a main road. Fantastic time and are returning in January 2010....

Reviews.Title: “Worth the visit”
Reviews.Author: Wondermum
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from Paris and stayed at the Le grand hotel des gobelins, boulevard avenue, Saint-marcel, it is only a 3 star hotel and quite small but well worth the money. We stayed in a standard double room and it was very nice, it was clean and a very nice bathroom, we stayed in no, 69 it was nice and quite. The staff there were very helpful with any query you had re the area they would help. The breakfast was continental but very filling. The metro stations are very close either Saint Marcel or Les gobelins will take you to most of the sights with not too much trouble and they are very efficient. We bought our metro passes at Ebbsfleet before we went so we were ready when we got to Paris, so much easier, we booked through expedia and we also got our tickets weeks before travelling. We arrived at Gare du nord walked to gare l'est only a few minutes and got off at Saint marcel only a few minutes to hotel very easy. Would certainly go back to the above hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I actually found the prefect hotel in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: thall4041
Reviews.Content: I went with friends to Paris, my second visit to this great city. The trip from the airport to the hotel, located in the St. Germaine District, was fast. The hotel, from the moment we walked into the lobby, felt right. The staff was friendly, and with 4 American women who can get by with a little French, they were so sweet and accomodating. There was never a moment we felt like we were bothering the staff with requests for recommendations on sights and restaurants. The rooms were actually a nice size for being in Europe where they tend to run small. We were on a main street with a Metro stop 2 blocks away. The hotel served breakfast in the morning with fresh fruit , cereals and croissants with coffee, tea and juice. We were all actually sad to leave. You would not be disappointed with staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: dallas61
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful hotel with a very convenient location. The staff was friendly and went out of their way to help us. Room was comfortable and spacious for a Paris hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful 10 night stay!”
Reviews.Author: Subira9
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Paris and we were glad we found this hotel on Tripadviser. Wonderful, charming location and the room was very clean. A Metro stop is on the corner, which was very convenient. Wonderful helpful staff, always cheerful.

Reviews.Title: “I don't understand the criticisms”
Reviews.Author: jkotler
Reviews.Content: I (a 60 something traveler) booked this hotel for 7 nights through an Expedia package--RT air + hotel came in at less than $1500. I traveled alone, and had a single, street-facing room (#11). I found that with the windows closed at night it was virtually soundproofed. Yes, the room was small, but not unbearably so. BEST shower in Europe! Glass-enclosed, so no water on floor, but marvelously hot water combined with incredible shower pressure: WAY beyond what I've come to expect. Bed was on the hard side, but I found it very very comfortable. There are extra pillows and blankets in armoire, which also had a decent number of (actual wooden) hangers. (Hotels in Europe tend not to have pants/skirts hangers; I've learned to bring my own. I found the staff--day and night--incredibly pleasant and accommodating--including the breakfast woman (weekdays) and man (weekends), especially if you even tried to speak a tiny bit of French. I agree with a recent poster that Cesar's isn't very good food (though cheap), but I had several good meals--especially the roast chicken--at the Canon (go left out entrance--at the corner of the 2 main streets). Unfortunately, the recommended seqfood place was never open during my week there--perhaps now out of business. But Petit Marguery is on Royal--about four blocks away. Although Gobelins is only Metro Line 7, there's an easy connection to Line 10 at Jussieu--as well as myriad others, of course. While I am admitedly used to walking, most folks will find there to be a very easy walk from the hotel to almost anywhere. For example, the Luxembourg Gardens are no more than 20-25 minutes away. The entire hotel, incidentally, is non-smoking: hard to tell that from their website. In passing, I can also add I had a very positive experience with the airport shuttle service.

Reviews.Title: “Not enough bangs for your bucks”
Reviews.Author: NLR
Reviews.Content: We have just returned home after a week spent in this hotel. We booked directly with the hotel on their 3 day plus package. The hotel is very clean, and is fantastically situated. There are absolutely terrific eating places nearby: the Cesar italian, and Anacreon fish restaurant both on the same side of the Boulevard as the hotel. The hotel is a 10 minute walk from Rue Mouffetard and its markets, and very very close to good transport connections. Bt we would never stay there again. Despite being a 3 star hotel and currently £125 per night, you get almost nothing but a clean room and a small shower (fantastically strong though). There is no kettle in the room, no fridge/minibar, breakfast was not included (despite this being their 'package' - the towels were thin and there were barely any toiletries. Finally the room was really noisy - with loud traffic all hours of the day and night. The two positive things were : free wifi, and BBC world. We would stay in the Gobelins area again but not in this 2 star masquerading as a three

Reviews.Title: “Fab Value for money hotel . Try it!!”
Reviews.Author: mandrontour
Reviews.Content: I can only echo other posts on here. The hotel is pleasent ,clean in a great location and the staff are superb.We stayed in room 64 and from the window we had a view(distant but still great) of the eifle tower. The guys on reception were Fantastic and couldt help us enough and about 5 doors down to the right of the hotel is a fantastic restarant ( I can highley recommend the seabass). The rooms are large but then no hotels in Paris are. This is my 10+ time in Paris and this hotel is by far and away the best I have stayed in and probabley the cheapest too.

Reviews.Title: “yet another glowing review for this hotel”
Reviews.Author: bking10
Reviews.Content: I don't have much to add to the other reviews - we also had an excellent experience at this hotel. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The hotel was very clean and comfortable. We would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “acceptable. fickle staff. decent location. clean. breakfast included.”
Reviews.Author: wanderblinder
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights. Single room on the third floor overlooking two streets. very small but washroom was clean. Reception on arrival was very good - the woman was friendly and welcoming and swift with check in. Breakfast was what I have come to expect - breads, ham, cheese, muesli, yogurt, some fruit, coffee (the quality of the coffee varied dramatically over the three mornings). The breakfast room attendant was aloof and did not speak english and was not warm to my attempts at french. My interaction with the staff during the stay was minimal - they request that you leave your key when you depart for the day - the staff varied from being friendly to being visibly inconvenienced by your attempts at complying with their request to leave your key. The walk to the metro is short - but the line is not the most convenient as you have to transfer to get to major sights. There are two supermarkets within 200m of the hotel - very useful.

Reviews.Title: “Clean,well run 3* hotel in pleasant area”
Reviews.Author: kadavar
Reviews.Content: We booked a "superior" room for 6 nights. The room on the 6th floor was small with very little storage space and didn't seem very "superior". We queried this at reception and were moved to a larger room on the 1st floor the next day. Although this room didn't have air conditioning we were at least able to move around without tripping over suitcases and each other. The decor of the room was ok and inoffensive. The room and public areas were clean. There was a small wall-mounted TV in the room with limited channels - the only English language channels being the insipid and repetitive BBC World Service and CNN. There was no minibar or refrigerator. A hairdryer was available in the bathroom. Our room was to the side of the hotel so traffic noise was not a major problem especially as the windows were double-glazed. For some reason there were no shower curtains in either of the bathrooms which resulted in water going everywhere and soaking toiletries and towels. We resorted to kneeling in the bath when showering to minimise the deluge. We don't know if this is the same in other bathrooms. The dining room is tiny which makes breakfast a cosy affair if everyone comes down at the same time. Getting a coffee can take several minutes of complicated manoeuvring! Breakfast itself is basic but adequate. All the staff were pleasant and helpful. There is a supermarket a few doors along Rue St Marcel and there is a reasonable selection of restaurants in the vicinity plus Rue Mouffetard is only a 10-15 minute stroll. Les Gobelins metro is about a 5 minute walk. All in all we enjoyed our stay at Les Gobelins; it is a clean, well run hotel with a bit of character in a pleasant area. Just remember that this is a modest 3-star hotel, not the Ritz and that you don't get a lot for your money in central Paris. It has more good points than bad and could be a good choice if you get a deal through a package or website.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, great location!!”
Reviews.Author: alan0056
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Grand hotel Les Gobelins in late June. The location couldn't of been much better! close to lots of restaurants, shops and a 5 min walk to the metro station. The room was small yet comfortable and clean with a great street view of Paris. The bathroom had been recently renovated so it was clean and spacious. The only downside was no air conditioning in the room, which made it quite hot, but the window was large and let a lot of air in so it wasn't too much of an issue. The staff were helpful and friendly, great value for money would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: sophies22
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at this hotel early July - Travelled with my sister in law and we had booked 2 single rooms both of which were fairly small but perfectly adequate and clean. The bathrooms were sparkling and modern. Staff at this hotel are so friendly and helpful - a real pleasure to find, particularly Jean-Marc! It is within easy access of the metro system, les Gobelins just a 5 minute walk away and Place d'Italie around 10 minutes away. Recommend the italian restaurant just down the road, Cesare, and the boulangerie opposite. Love Paris, will be returning for my 3rd trip next year and we will definitely choose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay.”
Reviews.Author: mister_mister1981
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one week. Advertised as a 3 star hotel and this is about right I would said. We had booked a standard room and I have to say I was a little disappointed with the room when we arrived. The decor was not great, it didn't feel totally clean. As many have said there was no shower curtain so water got everywhere in the bathroom. Also there was a lack of storage space in the room for clothes. I hate living out of a suitcase and have to unpack everything so we had to be quite creative with where we stored everything. After two nights in this room we were about to head out for the door and were dropping our keys off at reception when we were told that the wardrobe in our room was to be replaced (obviously they were aware of the lack of storage problem!) today. Would we like to move to a room that is exactly the same? There was no apology for the inconvenience of suddenly having to go back upstairs and pack up all our things. After it became clear that this wasn't a request we could turn down we hesitated just the right amount of time for them to also offer us an upgrade to a superior room. To be honest, I would have expected this straight away. So we moved. This was a much better room. Much more space. Nicer bathroom, more storage, better decor. I don't know how much more expensive this room was but I would rate this room as a 3.5 star room whereas the first was about 2.5. If you can I would recommend booking a superior room, it felt much more comfortable. Again, just a fan. No air con but it wasn't that hot anyway. Breakfasts were fine. After a week we were a bit bored of them but I've certainly had much much worse. Front desk were friendly. Location was great. The metro had direct links to the Louvre, Notre Dame (to name just two) and everywhere else was just one change away. Turning left out of the hotel rather than right led to better restaurants I think. If you fancy a good Italian meal while in Paris then go to Cesar's just down the road. I'd happily stay here again if I was to return to Paris but if you book a standard room don't expect a 3 star quality room - in my opinion they aren't.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Paris hotel with character”
Reviews.Author: Suburban_m0m
Reviews.Content: Stayed here June 27 through July 5, 2009 with my two teenage children. We had a triple occupancy room (hard to find in Paris) with 1 double bed and 1 single. Very spacious for Paris standards. Bathroom and toilette had both been recently updated. Read review about no shower curtain--this is common in France and not particular to this hotel. Staff couldn't have been more friendly and accommodating, The hotel lobby was beautiful. Didn't eat the breakfast (never got up in time). You can purchase the breakfast separately if you don't include it with your room stay. Room was modest (nothing fancy) but comfortable with large window that overlooked the beautiful neighborhood. This is in a nice, quiet area of Paris and was perfect for us to come back to after the maddening crowds near all of the major tourist attractions. Metro station is a short walk away and very easy to navigate. Lovely small shops and restaurants all around. Shop owners and restaurant staff couldn't have been more friendly and patient with us, given our limited French language skills. Free wireless internet available in the lobby. NOTE: Triple occupancy rooms do not have air conditioning no matter what any website tells you! My children and I LOVED our stay in Paris and would definitely stay this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, a good time”
Reviews.Author: tigfyc
Reviews.Content: THE GOOD: Wonderful room and spacious bathroom. Only 5 minute walk (or less) to the Metro Very quiet and peaceful--we had a wonderful view over the street Very comfortable THE BAD: There was no shower curtain, so water went everywhere. The hotel did not have washcloths--only hand towels. The breakfast was sparce The staff was not very friendly

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: ElvisinLA
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for six nights recently. Room was very neat, clean and comfortable. As always in Europe, a bit small. The staff were extremely kind and helpful and spoke English. One gentleman was so helpful one day when we not only had trouble with our ATM cards, but accidently locked ourselves out of the in-room safe! He solved all our problems quickly and kindly. BTW, safe is a great feature, nice to be able to store passports, credit cards, etc. The location is a short distance away from the touristy stuff, which is really nice. You can either stay close to the local restaurants, shops, etc. or take a short walk and be in the middle of all the Latin Quarter hubbub. Metro stops are an easy walk and if you're taking the RER to the airport a short bus ride will get you to the Port Royal stop. Be sure to try Cesar's Italian restaurant, it's excellent. The only caveat for this place is it's a bit noisy. Mainly street noise and sirens from the hospital. Certainly not the hotels fault, but if you need or want the windows open, be prepared for some noise. Our breakfast was included and was a nice variety of breads, cereals, cheese, juice, ham, coffee, etc. More than enough to start your day. Also having the Champion market down the street is very handy for any shopping needs.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: vivapilates
Reviews.Content: On the downside, the lift wasn't working and the room was small. BUT, on the upside, the staff were friendly and extremely helpful, the location was great, the hotel very charming, the breakfasts generous, the beds comfortable and the showers were hot and hard. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Cheerful Friendly and Helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: roamerCotswolds
Reviews.Content: All the staff were always cheerful and wanting to help and obviously enjoy their work.A good location with access to Metro and bus routes providing ease of travelling around to the main sites. A very good italian restaurant within yards. Breakfast room a little cramped but very accomodating staff

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for the Price”
Reviews.Author: louis91
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the "suite" for 6 nights with our 15 year old daughter. The rooms were small but very clean. The continental breakfast in the morning was great...croissants, ham, cheese, cereal, yogurt, etc. The front desk staff were awesome. All spoke English and were very helpful. Grocery store and bakery nearby. Hotel is very quiet at night despite being on a busy street. Metro station is a 5 min walk away. Bus stop right in front of the hotel. Airport shuttle wasn't there to pick us up so we ended up taking the RER without any problems. Much cheaper than a cab. Eat at Cesar's right down the street---it is wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with good metro access”
Reviews.Author: Mrsippi
Reviews.Content: Good for the price. Interior is a bit dated, but it is clean. New bathroom. Hated the shower. No place to put your soap and shampoo and never mind trying to pick these up if you drop them. You have to open the shower door and then drip water everywhere, unless you are a giraffe. Breakfast was very good--cereal, juice, fruit, coffee, tea and fresh breads. Left our bags in their closet all day on our last day. Was not locked, but no one too our things. Grocery store nearby. Bakeries and cafes too. Internet available, but very expensive, so didn't use. No heat at night. Radiator was cold. Only a problem one of the nights we stayed, though.

Reviews.Title: “Family Run - Great People”
Reviews.Author: nikitaandduker
Reviews.Content: Great people, great service, you can't go wrong. booked throught hotels.ca included breakfast which was good!! Staff spoke english at the front desk, helped us out with directions, best ways to find our way around paris. Would highly recommed. Rooms not to small by Paris standards

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Glenys60
Reviews.Content: From the smiling welcome when we checked in, to the rose on my bed on Valentine's day, we couldn't have felt more at home. Booking through Expedia we got a superior room, on the 6th floor, which was comfortable,and a well appointed bathroom with bath and shower. The breakfast was good with ham, cheese, croissants, brown & white bread, cake, cereals, several tinned fruits & lovely thick yogurt. The coffee was exceptionally good. The only slight drawback was the very small breakfast room, although this didn't cause any major problems even though the hotel was full. Hotel position is convenient for buses & metro, restaurants at the Rue Mouffetard & especially the Gare de Lyon "Le Train Bleu."Within walking distance & well worth Eur6.50 for coffee just to see inside.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel, but wouldnt go back...”
Reviews.Author: Holidaaaay
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Le Grand Hotel des Gobelins over the bank holiday weekend in August 2008 for the weekend. We arrived in Paris Gard du Nord around 10-10.30 on a friday night..and the hotel was around a good 40-50 mins away from the station by train. By the time we arrived at the station it was around midnight, we felt really scared walking out of the station and walking to the hotel. The streets were deserted. By the time we got to the hotel, we were starving and there were no restaurants or places to eat anywhere near by which were opened...and went to sleep hungry. The hotel was nice and clean, the shower room was also nice and it was nice and quiet throughout the night. Had breakfast in the morning, breakfast wasnt anything special, just tea and toast really...so we decided we'd rather have a lie in the next morning and miss breakfast. However the guy serving breakfast was very funny and entertaining.. While we were there we also went to disneyland paris...and we missed the last train home, and got the bus home which took absoutely ages...by the time we got back to our hotel is was around 2.30am.... altho the reception area is 24 hours...the doors were locked and no one at reception was to be seen or heard....we stood outside knocking/banging on the door for around 30 mins...which we really could have done without as we were absoutely shattered... the reception guy finally came out..and looked like he had gone for a nap... Overall this was an okish hotel, probably wouldnt use it again...but was ok for the price we paid...

Reviews.Title: “Le Grand Hotel des Gobelins good 3*”
Reviews.Author: discerning60
Reviews.Content: The hotel is small but friendly. The room we stayed in was a superior which was fine, nice bathroom and cleaned well every day - although the bed was the hardest I had ever slept in! (not so good) The breakfast room is very small and it was sometimes difficult to sit comfortably when it was full. Having said that the continental breakfast was good and the housekeeper keeping the platters full and clearing away was very friendly and accommodating. The location is very good, the metro and bus stops are just round the corner. it is within walking distance of the Siene. All in all a good 3* hotel for Paris standards. If I was going 3* again I would probably stay there.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: justhadtosay
Reviews.Content: Just had three nights at the Grand Hotel des Gobelins. We would recommend the hotel, it is extremely clean and comfortable. We had a superior room which was very large with a large bathroom and separate loo. The bed was comfortable, there is a tv but no English speaking channels. The room was quiet with a lovely traditional window overlooking the boulevard.The regular sirens from the police vehicles can become irritating but that is a general Paris thing not specific to this area. In fact at the weekend, it is fairly quiet. The staff are very pleasant and friendly. Breakfast is in a small room , not the choice of a large hotel but perfectly adequate. The hotel is in a non touristy location but not too far from a few metro stations and the batobus stop at Jardins des Plants. There are not many local restaurants but the (mentioned elsewhere) Au Bon Coin complete with checked tablecloths, is a must, very good food and nice staff who will explain the menu if you dont understand it all. Very French and we walked in on a sing song complete with accordion player which seemed private but never were we made to feel anything other than welcome and at home. There is a pleasant bar on the corner of the Rue des Gobelins, and also a very good Italian nearby (need to get there before 7.30pm or you will be in a queue). The food is good here but quite expensive, nearer to London prices. Beer is 7-8 euros a pint generally and wine can cost more than at home! The exchange rate doesn't help of course. Paris is as beautiful as ever but a lot of restaurants are touristy and seem cheap but the food is poor compared to UK standards and service very rushed to the point of pushing you out the door as fast as possible. The days of sitting outside a cafe watching the world go by seem to be over in the centre of the city which is a shame. The only thing is the service is so rushed we twice got the wrong bill which was cheaper! All in all we would recommend the hotel as booked with the train fare it was a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Top hotel good location”
Reviews.Author: BigSedge
Reviews.Content: We were on the 6th floor over looking the roof tops of Paris and could see the Eiffel Tower light up each night. The air con worked very nicely but didnt really need it. The shower was the best I have ever had in a hotel. They recommended a superb restaurant about 200 mtrs away which was like walking into the set of ALLO ALLO great food good atmosphere "Au Bon Coin" It was so good on teh first night we actually went back on the Saturday as well. one tip when you leave your luggage if you are on a later flight do not put the bag at the back of the room as it will get blocked in. The Metro is a 2 minute walk round the corner. and you are short walk from a very good local market.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money...”
Reviews.Author: Shiruster
Reviews.Content: A great hotel at a fantastic price. My wife usually insists on staying in 4 or 5* hotels but this time we were on a budget as far as the hotel was concerned.
