You get what you pay for but with this hotel you probably get a little bit more. Cheaper and obviously much more character than the cheap hotel chains. The hotel is a short 10 minute ride on the Metro from the centre of Paris and is in an area which gives you a much truer experience of Parisian life than if you were to stay in one of the tourist areas. The staff were exceptionally helpful in every way. Breakfast is included and is more than enough. These are not criticisms as far as I am concerned but some people may be put off by the lack of coffee making facilities in the rooms and the fact you have to pay a couple of quid for internet access. Also - we visited in October so it wasn't a problem but not all of the rooms have air conditioning. I would definitely recommend it and would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nysy
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at this hotel. It was a great relief to find the front desk staff speaking English! Our room was a triple and was a tight space. Breakfast was nice, lots of bread. The staff keeps a tight watch on who comes down to eat. Very near a few metro stops so pretty easy to get around. You pay for internet access as in most places in Europe. Overall a good experience, although the next time I stay in Paris I'll stay in a more lively neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,no facilities!”
Reviews.Author: cosmicspirit
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my daughter. It was basic and clean, but the internet site i saw said it had a restaurant, which it didn't.When i asked for a coffee i was told they had a machine in reception but no milk.Our satellite TV didn't work and our bedroom was grim! I complained and got nowhere.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, charming, convenient!”
Reviews.Author: MLG0969
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend stay with a friend. The hotel is quite charming, with squeaky clean bathrooms, very comfy beds and great shower. Staff were also very nice and accommodating...my friend politely requested a room change (hers was on 1st floor, front of hotel) as she found her's to be noisy (from lift calls, breakfast set-up, etc.), and the response was welcoming and instantly sorted out. She was moved to a room at the back. Breakfast is fresh and plentiful. Location is great - v. near the Metro and a fantastic market nearby. Couldn't ask for much more!! Would definitely return and recommend this to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: dfa9a
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel. I was a little apprehensive about finding a nice place to stay in Paris (without going bankrupt) that would accommodate me, my wife, and my 2 year old child. This was a perfect selection. There's plenty of things to do nearby and the staff was wonderful. Tip: be wary about having them call a cab for you. Apparently in Paris they charge you for the ride over to the hotel. Annoying to find that out.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel, but wouldnt go back.”
Reviews.Author: VickyLynn
Reviews.Content: I saw this hotel on trip advisor, so I felt comfortable booking it. Althought the staff was friendly and the rooms were clean, I wouldnt recommend it for the price. The room we stayed in had a shower drain that didnt work, and drained to slowly to shower in. When I told the person working at the front desk, her response was "yes, this is not the first time this has happened" From her reaction, I could tell it wouldnt be the last. She explained that to fix it they would have to rip out the shower, and it didnt seem like that was an option. Fortuneatly right before we left for Paris, I was able to change hotels 3 of our 4 nights to a hotel closer to the area we wanted to stay in and we only spent one night at this hotel. The hotel we found was in a much better location, was very clean, with a good breakfast just as included with Des Gobelins, for 40 Euro less!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for kids!”
Reviews.Author: anderwood
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 days in June 2008 and were very happy with our stay. The internet connection is not convenient, since they said that there was free access in the lobby, but failed to say that it was the restaurant's next door, so it turned off later in the evening. Couldn't use our laptop so we had to use their computer in the lobby which didn't work well. But we traveled with our 2 year old and the pack and play they provided was excellent. (Although I'm sure his crying some nights disturbed our neighbors. Can't attest to the thick walls.) The staff were incredibly friendly and made our stay in Paris very personal. They let us keep our stroller out of sight in the lobby so it wouldn't take up our hotel room. The lobby was nice and the elevator (while slow) made getting our bags to the room much easier. The room was big for European standards and the bathroom was recently renovated and very big. The location was ideal - sharing a block with a fantastic Italian restaurant (Cesar's) and a good cafe. It was a ten minute walk to Rue de Mouffetard with a fruit market, excellent cafes and a playground for our son. We took walks to Luxembourg Garden (35 minutes), Jardin des Plantes (6 minutes), Notre Dame (40 minutes) and had a wonderful stay! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “reasonable hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Lincstraveller3
Reviews.Content: Have not stayed in Paris before and so have nothing really to compare this with. Rooms clean if a little dated, bathrooms recently refitted and as others have said large. Breakfast room is very tiny and creates a few problems although food is fine. Staff excellent, nothing too much trouble. Would recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel just within 10 minutes of Latin Quarter”
Reviews.Author: gaynorandjohn
Reviews.Content: Small Hotel with a great heart. Reception and other hotel staff helpful. Complimentary breakfast good value with decent orange juice. Rooms clean and of reasonable size with clean towels and toiletries supplied every day. Five minute walk from the Metro (le Gobelins on Line 7) and Buses to Notre Dame and Opera. Ten Minutes walk from the centre of Latin Quarter. Only downside is no air conditioning in rooms and it can be a little noisy from street noise if the window is open. Would use again with no hesitation

Reviews.Title: “Comfy basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: sfbadvr
Reviews.Content: Rooms are basic with minimal decoration but clean and comfortable. We had a room on the sixth floor, the bathroom was small but we had views of the Eiffel, Pantheon and Notre Dame! Though we were street facing I was not bothered with any noise and am a light sleeper. Breakfast was included for us and quite pleasant. The food is fresh and satisfying. I would suggest starting earlier, say before 9am as the room can be very crowded as typical of Parisian eateries. The front desk was very warm and pleasant and helpful. R. Mouffetard is very close by. We headed there for meals often. We also liked that the B line of the RER was close by so that we could more easily head to CDG. Wifi, like other Parisian hotels, is free and available but usually only strong enough on the lobby floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: redmolster
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel twice and think it's great. I have stayed in quite a few hotels in Paris and think that the Hotel des Gobelins is better than the 4 star hotels i've stayed in in Paris. The hotel is nothing fancy but it is clean, rooms are a decent size and breakfast is good. I think the location of this hotel is great. It's close to two metro stations and the area is a nice place to stay. It's not too noisy but has a few nice restaurants very close. I will definately stay at the Gobelins again when I'm next in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap & Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: poshtotty
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while viewing property in the area. We were out and about all day and most of the evening, so the hotel was really just a bed for the night. The rooms we saw were small and basic, but clean and tidy. The shower pressure was fab, but the tray filled very quickly and was in danger of overflowing. Our baggage was held up in industrial action. No big deal, but the staff were very helpful and kept chasing it for us. However, the ladies in charge of the breakfast room were a bit stern at times! Remember that breakfast finishes at 10.30am PROMPT, but the patisserie across the road is great. There's no need to pay for internet access in reception - just use Control + N for a new web page.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal for a great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: britbug8
Reviews.Content: My roommate and I booked this hotel after reading great reviews on Trip Advisor. All of the reviews were true: This hotel is small, but clean. Cheap but great service. A little off the beaten path, but easily accessible via metro and walking. We could see the Cathedral from our room on the 5th floor. Our room faced the street, but the location is lower traffic than in central Paris which was great. We recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again next time I'm in town”
Reviews.Author: GG22
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel in an old-style apartment block. Reasonable room rates for a location within walking distance of the big Paris attractions. The room was small but clean and well-equiped with a decent size bathroom in excellent condition. Being English, I would have liked tea-making facilities in the room too. Staff were friendly and helpful and available around the clock. Breakfast was basic but sufficient and the room it was served in was on the small side with residents squeezed in or having to wait for space. My only quibble was that the walls were thin and the plumbing noisy. We were woken up early on our first morning, after a very late arrival, by our neighbours showering at 6.30am. From then on their alarm clock woke us up regularly - at least I learnt the French for earplugs! I would definately stay here again on my next trip to Paris, unless my budget expands considerably, but I will be taking those earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Janichic
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Le grand hotel les gobelins for 4 nights and would recommend it for the price range. My room was small (fine for one person) but clean. The bathroom was brand new and the shower had excellent water pressure. The hotel has a nice lobby and pleasant staff. The metro 'les gobelins' is convenient, although it only has access to one metro line (7). There is also a bus stop with a convenient bus (91) that goes from Montparnasse to Bastille.

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: fatstuart
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here while visiting friends in Paris. We loved that we could walk so many places and that the Metro was so close by. Our room was a typical small European Hotel room but it was clean and the view of the street below was nice. We enjoyed breakfast every morning in the dining area. We also liked the fact that there were some good parks for jogging close by as well. Until either one of us starts making the really big bucks, we will stay in Hotel Les Gobelins when we come to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Room - don't pay estra for bigger room”
Reviews.Author: Mike0001
Reviews.Content: Paid extra for a Superior Room and it was tiny, very dissapointed. When i complained at the front desk, the person was not able to deal with it and no manager in til next day. Very rude and dismissive.

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean, very nice staff.”
Reviews.Author: dejNewYork
Reviews.Content: We wanted to find a good, inexpensive, conveniently located hotel in Paris. This hotel was very clean. The rooms are small, but the bed was comfortable. Watch out for shower - it's not like an American shower. There isn't a shower curtain and the floor can get wet if you're not careful. We took the Metro and there were 2 stops near us. The staff was VERY helpful and nice and spoke English well. There's a supermarket a few stores down if you want to buy lunch materials.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel at a good price for central Paris !”
Reviews.Author: IEATALLTHECRUSTS
Reviews.Content: Les Gobelins is easy to get to if you travel light, if you are carting luggage from CDG then think taxi or shuttle as the change from RER to metro at Les Halles is quite a haul, upstairs along moving walkways and up and down escalators. Once you arrive at metro Les Gobelins head down hill 150 metres, turn right past Cesar restaurant {very good and popular with local Parisiens} another 150 metres brings you to Les Gobelins hotel. The lift is a bit shakey but does the job, otherwise its a spiral staircase. The room we had on the fifth floor overlooking the main steet was very nice, double bed and a small single tucked in the corner, good views out over the Paris rooftops and a glimpse of the Eiffel tower between the buildings opposite. very quiet at night, with double glazed windows and heavy drapes. the bathroom very clean and roomy +separate toilet. The breakfast room is a complete joke, about 15 of us crammed in a room lined up with our little dishes and plates, then after you squeeze your way back to the table you have to do it all again to fill your coffee cup, forget it ! walk down the hill to the main intersection at Blvd St Marcel and on the right is a beautiful boulangerie. The latin qtr is about a ten minute stroll, you can walk down to the Siene in about twenty five minutes, and the same time will get you via blvd Port Royal to Montparnasse. The Parisien people really were delightful, offering advice to us if we were perusing bus /metro timetables, and even if we began the query in French they would if they could switch to English, or direct us with smiles and gestures in French. Altogether a fantastic experience, one that i know we will repeat in the near future. I would certainly use Les Gobelins again, apart from the breakfast room it has a lot of plus points. The area around it is very safe, and relatively quiet after the hustle and bustle of the main tourist spots it was nice to get back to the area at night and relax in one of the bars/ retaurants, and prices a lot lower than the touristy spots too. Up the road is a "Campion" supermarket with a good selection of wines beers and spirits downstairs, with the boring grocery items on the ground floor. A big thankyou to Paris and to your people, we will see you again soon. Merci

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: BlackDahlia47
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel on Trip Advisor and gave it a go. The room was slightly worn but very clean (the bathroom was spotless), and the staff were quite friendly. The hotel is about a 5 minute walk from the Metro. Recommended as a good value hotel in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “J'adore Hotel Gobelins!”
Reviews.Author: Haileyb
Reviews.Content: I was slightly worried about staying in the hotel after reading a couple of bad reviews, but thankfully the hotel was delightful. It was a stones throw away from the metro and only a short walk from all the cool jazz bars and wonderful restaurants! The best thing about this hotel is that it is not set in a busy part of Paris, in fact I could have spent my entire time in the Latin Quarter as it was so relaxed and full of quirky shops. The staff were utterly delightful and couldn't do enough to help whenever it was needed. Those wanting a generic and characterless hotel should stay at a chain type hotel, but those wanting to stay at a proper Parisian hotel should stay here. My room was not massive but it was adaquate and the bathroom was spot on. I will definately stay here next time I go to Paris, if not for the hotel itself but for the delicious Patisserie across the road!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience following TA reviews”
Reviews.Author: Mattress07
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I booked a weekend at this hotel in mid-july. I always look at TA, and positive reviews were bourne out by an enjoyable stay. The hotel is a good 3 star. We stayed in a standard room which was fairly small, but clean and comfortable. Staff were friendly and efficient, and breakfast was good value although with the many cafes/patisseries around I'd recommend going out. Location is on the edge of the Latin Quarter/St Germain, and is an ideal base to explore the 'real' Paris away from the tourist traps around the main sites. Metro stop 'Le Gobelins' is 5-10 mins walk to take you anywhere you want to go in Paris. There are many cafes, restaurants, bars in this area so perfect for people watching. Overall, enjoyed our stay and would ceratinly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: fundriver
Reviews.Content: Teenage daughter and I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in July. We had a standard twin room which wasn't huge but was clean with comfortable beds. The bathroom looked fairly new and had a bath and shower. It was huge! The staff were all very friendly and helpful and all spoke excellent English (so not much chance to practise our French here!) Our room didn't have A/C as such but was provided with an electric fan. The nearest Metro station was only about 5 minutes walk and you could probably walk to Notre Dame in about 30 -40 minutes I would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Calgarystonecutter
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 5 nights. First night was in a room with no airconditioning. It was small, but clean. Modern bathroom. Next four nights where on top floor in smaller room, with air conditioning. Bathroom was new and clean, room was cozy with nice few of Paris skyline. Only real complaint was the beds, they where small and not so comfortable. Hotel is a little out of the way, but is close to metro and easy walk into the Latin Quarter. Large number of nice cafes and resturants in area, that have great food at resonable prices. Staff where helpful and polite, and there was always someone at front desk.Breakfeast was good as well, simple contintenal, but definetly enough food to fill you up. Gracery store just down the street so convient to pick up snacks for touring around Paris (Saved us lots of money on water and fruit) Overall I felt hotel was what we expected and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sunrisewatcher74
Reviews.Content: It was a good stay at this hotel because it's not very easy to find a clean and cheap hotel in cities like Paris or London and you can't go wrong booking with this one.The location is not exactly on the Champs Elysèes but it's in a quiet and very charming neighborhood; within walking distance you can catch the metrò to go everywhere you like;there are a lot of bistrò, cafè, fast food, a Starbucks nearby and even a supermarket just close to the hotel entrance.The staff is superfriendly and they really can help you with detailed informations about everything you ask.We stayed by a deluxe room that was very spacious and ultra clean;the only complain that I experienced was the fact that the walls are too thin and without earplugs you can have difficulties goin'asleep;beyond that I truly recommend this hotel to everyone who wants to explore a beautiful city without spending a fortune.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: rhemelb
Reviews.Content: We are an Australian famiy with a 9 year old daughter. We had 5 nights at Le Grand Hotel des Gobelins-our first time in France. After reading many of the trip advisor reviews we were delighted to find that this comfortable and friendly hotel went far beyond our expectations. Our room was large enough to comfortably fit a queen sized bed and a single bed.The bathroom was modern and super clean with a powerful shower. And after a big day wandering the exquisite Parisian streets it was such a treat to soak in a big bathtub! Despite staying in a front room of this hotel, it was incredibly quiet at night. Breakfast was delicious- plenty of variety. The reception staff were particularly charming and informative. As for location: a local supermarket is just a few shops down. The closest metro station is just a quick 5min walk away and it was wonderful for the three of us to be soaking up the sights, sounds and tastes of the Rue Mouffetard within just a 10 minute walk from the hotel. We would recommend Le Grand Hotel des Gobelins to any discerning traveller and to families with children.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: blueiii
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a wonderful place to stay in Paris! I was traveling alone and the neighborhood is very safe, clean, and attractive. I was pleased that the hotel's own website was set-up to accept reservations. Without having to go through a third-party, I felt more confidence in my reservation confirmation, which was emailed to me within 6 hours of my making the reservation on-line. The room rate was phenomenal - 85 euros a night for a room with a double bed. My room was small (if you want a large room, plan to stay at a 4 or 5 star hotel and pay plenty), but it was clean and very serviceable. The bathroom was also small but private, with a stand-up shower, great water pressure and an adjustable sliding shower head (I'm rather short so this was very nice). I had room #35, a corner room with two windows. Even with the busy street below one of my windows, it was peaceful at night. True, the hotel is not near big touristy attractions, but it is near some very quaint neighborhoods. The Les Gobelins metro stop is just down the block and can get you across town very easily. As others have mentioned, there is a Champion food store (a more American type grocery store) just a few doors away from the hotel. La Mouff - a fabulous market street is a quick walk north on Avenue Gobelins. The staff was very helpful. The gentleman who works during the day speaks excellent English and is extremely helpful. One of the night workers was less fluent in English and didn't appear too helpful, but other than that the staff was great. I did not have the breakfast at the hotel. Honestly, it confuses me why anyone would. For a short stroll down the street or to the aforementioned La Mouff, there are patisseries, boulangeries, and cafes abounding. Also, don't expect to get any ice! Not just at the hotel, but anywhere. I was in Paris for over a week and never saw a cube of it! :)

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: HampshireParis
Reviews.Content: Our room did not represent the wonderful photographs displayed on the hotel website. It was in the attic area, very cramped and just enough room to walk around the double bed. The bedside light was hanging off the wall revealing a gapping hole and more electrical wiring. The ensuite was very tiny and room enough for one. Not a romantic experience. The cobbled street mentioned is not outside the hotel, but quite some distance away. The booking was made through Eurostar who use another agent for the booking of hotels, as yet a week later I have still not had an acknowledgement regarding my complaint. However, the hotel is clean, breakfast good and the staff very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent !”
Reviews.Author: Sonic007
Reviews.Content: After looking through many reviews on Tripadvisor, I decided on Le Grand Hotel des Gobelins and are we glad that we did ! The hotel: The hotel is very charming and even though there is a road directly in front of it, we found that we could not hear the traffic at all and that we had a very good nights sleep. The entrence hall is very nice and the rooms are of a good size for Paris. We found the bed very comfortable and the room very clean and tidy. The rooms are nicely decorated and the staff are very pleasent and helpful. Staff: Staff were very helpful and the guy at recption was always ready to help us out and made us feel very welcome. The rooms: We were very impressed with the rooms. They were very clean and we were not dissapointed in any way. There is a desk and chair as well as an LCD television and enough space to hang up coats / clothes. Television has a range of French and English channels. We wanted a good bathroom and this one was very good. With a nice bath that had great water flow and tiles that looked brand new, it was really clean. Bathroom came with lot's of towels, soap, shampoo. Well stocked. Also has a a hairdryer. The view from the windows will depend where you are. From tof the hotel willlet you see the Eiffeltower in the distance and the Pantheon. The rear windows give on to the inner courtyard. Location: This hotel is in a great location and there is a Metro station just at the end of the road. About 7 minutes walk. Although you can walk into central Paris, it is quite a way on foot and although you can do it, it isnt too easy if you have lot's of luggage with you. Just take a metro from just down the road. Eating out: You can have breakfast in the breakfast room although we decided to head out early and a few doors down the road (on the opposite side of the road) there is a lovely boulangerie where you can get fresh croicesants, bread, Chocolate cakes, etc....... A must if you are coming to stay in France. Just down the road (about 5 minutes walk) you will also find a "Champion" supermarket. Getting back at night: The hotel is open late and you can easily stay out late in Paris. Do remember that the Paris Metro will have it's last train around 1.30am. There is however a night bus that you can catch that goes very close to Les Gobelins and once you get off, the hotel is about 10 minutes walk. Useful for when you realise you need to get back and it is very late. We found the area quite safe. Overall impression: If you don't mind catching a tube into central Paris and a little walking then this hotel is the one for you. Very nice rooms and helpful staff, this was a very pleasent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LAKELK
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two weeks in July of 2006. The hotel is in a good location - near the Metro (subway), and with bakeries and other stores near by. The hotel was clean and the rooms were comfortable. The front desk personnel were extremely helpful. I booked directly through the internet on the hotel's website and this worked out very well. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and would stay there again.

HotelInfo.Name: Grand Hotel des Gobelins
HotelInfo.Address: 57 boulevard Saint Marcel, 75013 Paris, France
